alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 10:06PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Worcester, northwestern Middlesex and northeastern Franklin Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1005 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Peterborough to near Swanzey. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Occasional cloud to ground lightning and heavy downpours can also be expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Leominster, Fitchburg, Orange, Gardner, Athol, Winchendon, Lunenburg, Townsend, Montague, Lancaster, Templeton, Sterling, Westminster, Ashburnham, Barre, Hubbardston, Princeton, Ashby, Northfield and Leverett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County
